pr_title: [miio] Xiaomi Robot Vacuum Channel "state_code" and "error_code" added

timeline.message:
[miio] Channel state_code and error_code added

Up to now, the status and error codes have only been output as text. On the one hand, this makes it complicated to create a mapping for your own status/error message (for example, in another language), and on the other hand, messages that are not yet implemented are only passed on as "UNKNOWN".

The two channels state_code and error_code now output the integers directly, so a mapping to numbers can be easily done and new codes are also output.

Signed-off-by: Markus Schraufstetter <markus.schraufstetter@gmail.com>

[miio] Direct forwarding of the codes so that status/error codes which are not known to the binding are also forwarded and are not displayed as status code 0 or error code -1.

Signed-off-by: Markus Schraufstetter <markus.schraufstetter@gmail.com>

[miio] Fixed unique labels for the two new channels

Signed-off-by: Markus Schraufstetter <markus.schraufstetter@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText:
Sorry for catching this not in the earlier review, but the codechecker also complaints that this is not camelcase
Should be changed to errorCode
timeline.author: marcelrv

timeline.bodyText: What is the benefit of writing this in two lines instead of one?
timeline.author: J-N-K

replies.bodyText: This has no real advantage. I had only taken it from the original code to make it consistent.
replies.author: Markkuuss

timeline.bodyText: Same here: why is thsi a local variable (and other states are not)?
timeline.author: J-N-K

replies.bodyText: You are right, this makes no sense, I just made a small camel case changes. I just took it from the original code.
replies.author: Markkuuss

timeline.message:
[miio] Renamed to "ID" to avoid breaking changes.

Signed-off-by: Markus Schraufstetter <markus.schraufstetter@gmail.com>
